data.title: worldleadersindex.org
data.text:
508 BC Roman Republic

27 BC Roman Empire

260 - 274 AD Secession of the provinces of Britanica, Gallia and Belgica,

retrospectively known as Imperium Galliarum (Gallic Empire)

17 Jan 395 Empire split into the Western and Eastern Roman empires

23 Aug 476 - 553 Kingdom of Visigoths

04 Sep 476 Last Roman Emperor is deposed

03 Oct 569 Kingdom of the Lombards

14 Apr 754 Founding of the Papal State

781 - 1014 Frankish Kingdom of Italy

14 May 1004 - 10 May 1796 Style "King of Italy" used by the Holy Roman Emperors

c. 1100 Italy fractured into many independent states

15 May 1796 - 29 Jun 1797 Transpadane Republic (Lombardy, Mantua, western Venice)

29 Jun 1797 - 28 Apr 1799 Repubblica Cisalpina (Cisalpine Republic)

28 Apr 1799 - 29 Apr 1800 Austrian occupation

29 Apr 1800 - 26 Jun 1802 Cisalpine Republic (restored)

26 Jun 1802 Repubblica Italiana (Italian Republic, in Northern Italy only)

18 Mar 1805 - 21 Apr 1814 Regno Italiana (Kingdom of Italy [Napoleonic])

1814 Pre-1796 states restored

1859 - 17 Mar 1861 Unification of Italy

23 Jun 1860 Nice and Savoy annexed by France

17 Mar 1861 Regno Italiana (Kingdom of Italy)

20 Sep 1870 Rome (the last remaining territory of the Papal States),

is annexed to Italy

10 Sep 1919 South Tyrol annexed from Austria

07 Jun 1929 Vatican City state established

09 May 1936 - 19 May 1941 Italy annexes Ethiopia

06 Apr 1939 - 03 Sep 1943 Albania in personal union with Italy

12 Nov 1942 - 1944 Corsica, Savoia and Nice reincorparated in to Italy

10 Sep 1943 - 02 May 1945 Repubblica Sociale Italiana (Social Republic of Italy);

declared in German occupied Italy north of the Gustav line

north of the former Kingdom of Naples

10 Sep 1943 - 17 Sep 1947 Allied ocupation

01 May 1945 - 26 Oct 1954 Allied-Yugoslav occupation of Trieste

18 Jun 1946 - Repubblica Italiana (Republic if Italy)

10 Feb 1947 Paris Peace Treaty ceded Istria, Fiume and Zara (Zadar)

to Yugoslavia (Croatia); Tende and La Brigue to France

(following a pleblisite) and Sassan island to Albania.

Italy renouncs claims to former African colonies and

to the Italian concession in Tienstin, China.

07 Mar 1948 Dodecanese Islands ceded to Greece

01 Jan 1958 Accession to the EEC

Kingdom of Italy (Medieval)

Monarchs

04 Sep 476 - 02 Feb 493 Odoacer of Germany, King of Italy

- Ostrogothic Kingdom of Italy -

02 Feb 493 - 30 Aug 526 Theodoric "The Great"

30 Aug 526 - 02 Oct 534 Athalaric

02 Oct 534 - 536 Theodatus

536 - 540 Vitiges

540 - 541 Ilibad

541 Eraric

541 Baduila

541 - 01 Jul 552 Totila

01 Jul 552 - Oct 553 Teias

- Kingdom of the Lombards -

568 - 28 Jun 572 Gausian, Alboin

28 Jun 572 - 574 Clefi

584 - 05 Sep 590 Autari

05 Sep 590 - 591 Theodelinda

591 - 616 Agilulfo

616 - 626 Bavarian, Adaloaldo

626 - 636 Arioald

636 - 652 Rotari

652 - 653 Rodoald

653 - 661 Bavarian, Ariberto I

661 - 662 Bavarian, Godepet

662 - 671 Beneventan, Grimaldo

671 Beneventan, Garibald

671 - 688 Bavarian, Pertarito

688 - 689 Alachis

688 - 700 Cuniperto

700 - 701 Luitperto

701 Raginperto

701 Rotharit

701 - 712 Ariberto II

712 - 744 Luitprando

744 - 749 Rachis

749 - Dec 756 Astolfo

Dec 756 - Jun 774 Desidiro

- Frankish Kingdom of Italy -

774 - 781 Carolingia, Carlomagno

781 - 08 Jul 810 Carolingia, Pipino

08 Jul 810 - 17 Apr 818 Carlolingia, Benardo

17 Apr 818 - 23 Sep 855 Carolingian, Lotaro I

15 Jun 844 - 12 Aug 875 Carolingian, Ludovico II "The Younger"

12 Aug 875 - 06 Oct 877 Carolingian, Carlo II "The Bald"

06 Oct 877 - 879 Carolingian, Carlomano of Bavaria

879 - 26 Dec 887 Carolingian, Carlo III "The Fat"

26 Dec 887 - Feb 889 Friuli, Berengario I (1st Time)

(continues in opposition)

Feb 889 - 12 Dec 894 Spoleto, Guido da Spoleto

May 891 - 15 Oct 898 Spoleto, Lamberto

22 Feb 896 - 08 Dec 899 Carolingian, Anolfo

(in opposition)

22 Feb - 896 Carolingian, Ratold

(sub-King in Milan)

900 - 905 Carolingian, Ludovico III "The Blind"

905 - 22 Apr 924 Friuli, Berengario I (2nd Time)

922 - 09 Jun 926 Burgundy, Ruldofo

(in opposition to 924)

09 Jun 926 - 10 Apr 948 Burgundy, Ugo di Arles

10 Apr 948 - 22 Nov 950 Burgundy, Lotaro II di Arles

22 Nov 950 - 963 d'Ivrea, Berengario II

15 Dec 950 - 963 d'Ivrea, Adalberto

(co-Monarch)

- Kingdom of Italy within the Holy Roman Empire -

02 Jul 964 - 07 May 973 Carolingia, Oddone I

07 May 973 - 07 Dec 983 Carolingia, Oddone II

07 Dec 983 - 23 Jan 1002 Carolingia, Oddone III

23 Jan 1002 - 1014 d'Ivrea, Arduino

1014 - 16 Jan 1556 The Monarchs of the Holy Roman Empire*

Major Italian States

Minor Italian States

Minor Italian States

Note: The style "King of Italy" ceased to be used by the Holy Roman Empire after

1556, though the empire continued to claim sovereignty over Northern Italy until

1806. The next holder of the title was Napoleon I of France.

Government: Monarchy.

Capital: Rome (Turin 1861-64, Florence 1864-70, Brindisi 1943-45)

Language: Italian, German, Albanian, Croatian, Slovene, Greek.

Religion: Roman Catholic.

National Anthem: "Marcia Reale d'Ordinanza" (Royal March of Ordinance).

National Emblem: Olive branch and Oak branch.

National Day: Unification Day, 17 March (1861).

National Motto: FERT.

Currency: Lira.

Kings

17 Mar 1861 - 09 Jan 1878 Savoia, Vittorio Emanuele II .................... 1820-1878

(King of Sardinia and Savoy)

09 Jan 1878 - 29 Jul 1900 Savoia, Umberto I ............................... 1844-1900

(Umberto IV di Savoia)

29 Jul 1900 - 09 May 1946 Savoia, Vittorio Emanuele III ................... 1869-1947

(relinquished all Royal powers Apr 1944)

05 Jun 1944 - 09 May 1946 Umberto Nicola Tammaso Giovanni Maria,

principe di Piedmonte .......................... 1904-1983

(Lieutenant General of the Realm)

09 May - 18 Jun 1946 Savoia, Umberto II .............................. s.a

(in exile in Portugal from 10 Jun 1946, styled 'Conde di Sarre')

Presidents of the Council of Ministers

21 Jan 1860 - 06 Jun 1861 Camillo Paolo Filipo Benso,

conte di Cavour, di Isobella e di Leri ......... 1810-1861

06 Jun 1861 - 04 Mar 1862 Bettino Ricasoli,

Baron Ricasoli (1st Time) ...................... 1809-1880

04 Mar - 09 Dec 1862 Urbano Rattazzi (1st Time) ...................... 1808-1873

09 Dec 1862 - 24 Mar 1863 Luigi Carlo Farini .............................. 1812-1866

24 Mar 1863 - 23 Sep 1864 Marco Minghetti (1st Time) ...................... 1818-1886

23 Sep 1864 - 17 Jun 1866 Alfonso Ferrero La Marmora ...................... 1804-1878

17 Jun 1866 - 11 Apr 1867 Bettino Ricasoli,

Baron Ricasoli (2nd Time)

11 Apr - 27 Oct 1867 Urbano Rattazzi (2nd Time)

27 Oct 1867 - 12 Dec 1869 Federico Luigi, conde Menabrea,

Marchese di Valdora ............................ 1809-1896

12 Dec 1869 - 10 Aug 1873 Domenico Giovanni Giuseppe Maria Lanza .......... 1810-1885

10 Aug 1873 - 25 Mar 1876 Marco Minghetti (2nd Time)

25 Mar 1876 - 23 Mar 1878 Agostino Depris (1st Time) ...................... 1813-1887

23 Mar - 18 Dec 1878 Benedetto Cairoli (1st Time) .................... 1825-1889

18 Dec 1878 - 12 Jul 1879 Agostino Depris (2nd Time)

12 Jul 1879 - 28 May 1881 Benedetto Cairoli (2nd Time)

28 May 1881 - 29 Jul 1887 Agostino Depris (3rd Time)

08 Aug 1887 - 09 Feb 1891 Francesco Crispi (1st Time) ..................... 1819-1901

09 Feb 1891 - 15 May 1892 Antonio Starabba,

Marchese di Rudini ............................. 1839-1908

15 May 1892 - 10 Dec 1893 Giovanni Giolitti (1st Time) .................... 1842-1928

10 Dec 1893 - 10 Mar 1896 Francesco Crispi (2nd Time)

10 Mar 1896 - 29 Jun 1898 Antonio Starabba,

Marchese di Rudini (2nd Time)

29 Jun 1898 - 24 Jun 1900 Luigi Pelloux ................................... 1839-1924

24 Jun 1900 - 15 Feb 1901 Giuseppe Saracco ................................ 1821-1907

15 Feb 1901 - 03 Nov 1903 Giuseppe Zanardelli ............................. 1826-1903

03 Nov 1903 - 27 Mar 1905 Giovanni Giolitti (2nd Time)

03 Nov - 27 Mar 1905 Tommaso Tittoni ................................. 1855-1931

27 Mar 1905 - 08 Feb 1906 Alessandro Fortis ............................... 1842-1909

08 Feb - 29 May 1906 Sidney Constantino Sonnino,

Baron Sonnino (1st Time) ....................... 1847-1922

29 May 1906 - 10 Dec 1909 Giovanni Giolitti (3rd Time)

10 Dec 1909 - 30 Mar 1910 Sidney Constantino Sonnino,

Baron Sonnino (2nd Time)

30 Mar 1910 - 27 Mar 1911 Luigi Luzzatti .................................. 1841-1827

27 Mar 1911 - 21 Mar 1914 Giovanni Giolitti (4th Time)

21 Mar 1914 - 19 Jun 1916 Antonio Salandra ................................ 1853-1909

19 Jun 1916 - 30 Oct 1917 Paolo Boselli ................................... 1838-1932

30 Oct 1917 - 23 Jun 1919 Vittorio Emanuele Orlando ....................... 1860-1952

23 Jun 1919 - 16 Jun 1920 Francesco Saverio Vincenzo de Paola Nitti ....... 1868-1953

16 Jun 1920 - 04 Jul 1921 Giovanni Giolitti (5th Time)

04 Jul 1921 - 25 Feb 1922 Ivanoe Bonomi (1st Time) ........................ 1873-1951

25 Feb - 30 Oct 1922 Luigi Facta ..................................... 1861-1930

Head of Government

30 Oct 1922 - 25 Jul 1943 Benito Amilcare Andrea Mussolini ................ 1883-1945 PNF

("Il Duce" ["The Leader"] from 24 Dec 1925)

Presidents of the Council of Ministers

25 Jul 1943 - 09 Jun 1944 Pietro Badoglio, Duca di Addis Abeba,

Marchese del Sabotino .......................... 1871-1956

09 Jun 1944 - 25 Jun 1945 Ivanoe Bonomi

(2nd Time; President of the Committee of National Liberation)

25 Jun - 10 Dec 1945 Ferruccio Parri ................................. 1890-1981

10 Dec 1945 - 18 Jun 1946 Alcide Amedeo Francesco De Gasperi .............. 1881-1954 DC

Heads of the Allied Military Government

10 Jul 1943 - 08 Jan 1944 Dwight David Eisenhower ......................... 1890-1969 (U.S)

08 Jan - 12 Dec 1944 Sir Henry Maitland Wilson ....................... 1881-1964 (U.K)

12 Dec 1944 - 29 Sep 1945 Sir Harold Alexander ............................ 1891-1969 (U.K)

29 Sep - Oct 1945 Joseph Taggart McNarney ......................... 1893-1972 (U.S)

Oct 1945 - 1947 Sir William Duthie Morgan ....................... 1891-1977 (U.K)

- 31 Jan 1947 John Clifford Hodges Lee ........................ 1887-1958 (U.S)

Chief commissioners of the Allied Control Commission

10 Nov 1943 - 16 Jan 1944 Kenyon A. Joyce ................................. 1879-1960 (U.S)

16 Jan - Jun 1944 Sir Noel Mason-Macfarlane ....................... 1889-1953 (U.K)

Jun 1944 - 31 Jan 1947 Ellery W. Stone ................................. 1894-1981 (U.S)

Military Governors of the Occupied Territories

10 Jul 1943 - 11 Dec 1944 Sir Harold Alexander ............................ s.a (U.K)

11 Dec 1944 - 17 Sep 1947 Mark Wayne Clark ................................ 1896-1984 (U.S)

PNF=Partito Nazionale Fascista (National Fascist Party, Italian Fascism, Italian Nationalism,

Mussolini personalist 1921-1943).

Style of the Italian Monarch: Per Grazia di Dio e per volontÃ della Nazione Re d'Italia

("By the Grace of God and by the Will of the Nation King of Italy, King of Sardinia, Cyprus, Jerusalem and Armenia, Duke of Savoy, of Genoa, of Montferrat, of Aosta, Chablais, Genevois and of Piacenza; Prince of Piedmont and Oneglia; Margrave in Italy, of Saluzzo, Ivrea, of Susa, of Ceva, of the Maro, of Oristano, of Cesana, and of Savona; Count of Maurienne, of GenÃ¨ve, of Nice, of Tenda, of Romonte, of Asti, of Alessandria, of Goceano, of Novara, of Tortona, of Vigevano and of Bobbio; Baron of Vaud and of Faucigny; Lord of Vercelli, of Pinerolo,

of Tarentaise, of the Lomellina, and of the Valley of Sesia, etc."). Lat: Rex Italiae.

Other Members of the House of Savoy were styled: Prince of Piedmonte and Naples, Prince of Carignano, Duke of Aosta, Duke of Chablis, Duke of Apulia, Duke of Montferrat, Duke of Genoa, Count of Turin, Count of Villafranca.

Orders: Ordine Supremo della Santissima Annunziata (Supreme Order of the Most Holy Annunciation).

Ordine dei Santi Maurizio e Lazzaro (Order of Saints Maurice and Lazarus).

Ordine della Corona d'Italia (Order of the Crown of Italy).

Ordine dell'Aquila romana (Order of the Roman Eagle).
